name: ramadan harira
ingredients: 7 tomatoes (peeled and chopped) or tomato paste
Spices: Turmeric, Ras el Hanout, Ginger, Salt, Pepper
steps: Cut the meat into small pieces. Finely mince the onion. Chop the parsley and coriander.
In a pot or pressure cooker, pour a drizzle of olive oil. Sauté the onion.
Add the parsley, meat, spices (turmeric, ras el hanout, ginger), salt, pepper, and pour half a glass of water. Let the meat brown.
Add the tomato pieces (or paste), chickpeas, and lentils (previously soaked).
Pour a drizzle of olive oil and 2 L of water. Cover and let cook on very low heat for 30 minutes (until the meat and chickpeas are cooked).
Prepare the tédouira: Mix the flour with water to obtain a liquid paste. Add it to the harira while stirring to avoid lumps (add in small quantities until the desired thickness is achieved).
After 30 minutes of cooking, add the vermicelli and the remaining coriander. Continue cooking for another 10 minutes.
Add a bit of chopped parsley again just before serving. Serve very hot, often with dates and lemon.
